      boolean equals(Object other) 
      Color getAmbient()
      The ambient color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

      • getScript

        public final MaterialScript getScript()
        Name of material from an installed script file. This will override the color element if the script exists.

      • getShader

        public final Shader getShader()

      • getRenderOrder

        public final Double getRenderOrder()
        Set render order for coplanar polygons. The higher value will be rendered on top of the other coplanar polygons

      • getLighting

        public final Boolean getLighting()
        If false, dynamic lighting will be disabled

      • getAmbient

        public final Color getAmbient()
        The ambient color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

      • getDiffuse

        public final Color getDiffuse()
        The diffuse color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

      • getSpecular

        public final Color getSpecular()
        The specular color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

      • getEmissive

        public final Color getEmissive()
        The emissive color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

      • getDoubleSided

        public final Boolean getDoubleSided()
        If true, the mesh that this material is applied to will be rendered as double sided

      • getPbr

        public final Pbr getPbr()
        Physically Based Rendering (PBR) material. There are two PBR workflows: metal and specular. While both workflows and their parameters can be specified at the same time, typically only one of them will be used (depending on the underlying renderer capability). It is also recommended to use the same workflow for all materials in the world.

      • setScript

        public final void setScript(MaterialScript script)
        Name of material from an installed script file. This will override the color element if the script exists.

      • setShader

        public final void setShader(Shader shader)

      • setRenderOrder

        public final void setRenderOrder(Double renderOrder)
        Set render order for coplanar polygons. The higher value will be rendered on top of the other coplanar polygons

      • setLighting

        public final void setLighting(Boolean lighting)
        If false, dynamic lighting will be disabled

      • setAmbient

        public final void setAmbient(Color ambient)
        The ambient color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

      • setDiffuse

        public final void setDiffuse(Color diffuse)
        The diffuse color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

      • setSpecular

        public final void setSpecular(Color specular)
        The specular color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue/alpha, each in the range of [0,1].

      • setEmissive

        public final void setEmissive(Color emissive)
        The emissive color of a material specified by set of four numbers representing red/green/blue, each in the range of [0,1].

      • setDoubleSided

        public final void setDoubleSided(Boolean doubleSided)
        If true, the mesh that this material is applied to will be rendered as double sided

      • setPbr

        public final void setPbr(Pbr pbr)
        Physically Based Rendering (PBR) material. There are two PBR workflows: metal and specular. While both workflows and their parameters can be specified at the same time, typically only one of them will be used (depending on the underlying renderer capability). It is also recommended to use the same workflow for all materials in the world.
